name: Flunitrazepam (Rohypnol)
summary: A potent long-acting benzodiazepine hypnotic, formerly used for severe insomnia but now tightly controlled or banned in many countries.
description: Flunitrazepam is a high-potency benzodiazepine with strong hypnotic, sedative, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant properties. It has a long elimination half-life, making it effective for sleep induction and maintenance. Due to its amnesic effects and history of misuse, including as a 'date rape' drug, Rohypnol is heavily regulated and not approved for use in the United States. It is still prescribed in some countries for severe, refractory insomnia or as a pre-anesthetic medication.

metadata.dea_schedule: Schedule IV (in some countries); not approved in U.S.

monitoring_required: Signs of misuse, dependence, and tolerance

sections.text: Binds to benzodiazepine sites on GABA-A receptors, enhancing GABA's inhibitory effect and increasing chloride influx, leading to hyperpolarization and CNS depression.

adult.insomnia: 1–2 mg orally at bedtime; max 2 mg/day

sections.geriatric: Start with 0.5–1 mg to minimize fall and confusion risk
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; consider lower dose
sections.renal_impairment: No adjustment, but use with caution

sections.text: Onset: 30–60 minutes; Duration: 8–12 hours (effects can persist up to 24 hours).

other: High misuse potential; sometimes illicitly used in drug-facilitated crimes
Avoid with alcohol or other CNS depressants

items: Respiratory function if used with other depressants

sections.pregnancy: Category D – avoid unless benefits outweigh risks
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; not recommended
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; start low and monitor

sections.text: Taper gradually over weeks to avoid severe withdrawal symptoms, including seizures.

items: Extremely restricted in many countries due to abuse potential
Long half-life increases risk of next-day impairment
Tablets may contain a blue dye in some regions to deter misuse
